roleset.name: get, capture

example.name: quasi-agentive
example.text: The employees also said [the project]-1 may have been snagged *trace*-1 by budgetary concerns.

example.name: locative instrument
example.text: But [the effort]-1 became snagged *trace*-1 on the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance.
example.arg: on the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance

example.name: different kind of instrument
example.text: [The deficit-reduction bill]-1 became snagged *trace*-1 over efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference.
example.arg: over efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference

example.name: more obviously capture
example.text: John snagged the frisbee out of mid-air with his teeth.

roleset.note: Based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.
